summary: EPIQ Life member platform with dual authentication (Internet Identity + Firebase/EPIQ Shield) and an EPIQ Wallet module created and managed entirely within EPIQ Life, with strict separation from EPIQ Treasury and on-chain balances as the source of truth.
architectural_notes: EPIQ Wallet key/seed/address generation and signing occur only in EPIQ Life; EPIQ Treasury must never generate/store/handle user private keys or seed phrases.
On-chain DAO canister(s) are the source of truth for EPQ/EPC balances; Life and Treasury independently query balances read-only (no balance push sync).
Transaction flow separation: users sign transactions in EPIQ Life; Treasury signs only its own admin/multisig transactions; systems exchange only public wallet addresses and read-only balance data.

existing_features.title: Ensure wallet creation is strictly manual: do not auto-provision any wallet during enrollment, profile creation, login, or Firebase sync. Wallets are created only when the user explicitly triggers the create action in the UI.

Add frontend UI for EPIQ Wallet management (in/under the existing wallet area): display a list of the userâ€™s EPIQ wallets (up to 9), and provide a 'Create Wallet' flow that shows the generated address, private key, and recovery phrase exactly once with strong warnings and a required acknowledgment checkbox before closing.

Integrate frontend data fetching/mutations for EPIQ Wallets using React Query (new query hooks and mutations) and backend actor calls, including cache invalidation so that creating a wallet immediately updates the wallet list in the UI.

Add a minimal in-app Phase 1 Testing Plan page/section (read-only) that lists the Phase 1 tests for dual authentication (Internet Identity + EPIQ Shield/Firebase), session transitions, user sync, and duplicate prevention, to be executed after wallet functionality is confirmed working.

new_feature_requests.summary: Initialize EPIQ Wallet in EPIQ Life with manual user-created wallet setup that generates wallet address, private key, and recovery seed phrase
Support up to 9 member wallets per account within EPIQ Life (user-created; no automatic wallet provisioning on enrollment)
Phase 1 testing plan for EPIQ ID / dual authentication: verify dual auth, user sync, session transitions, and auto-mapping without duplicates

Add backend support for EPIQ Wallets in EPIQ Life: persist up to 9 wallets per user (by caller Principal), each wallet containing at minimum: walletId/index, label (optional), createdAt timestamp, public address, and any metadata needed to support listing and later reference.

Implement backend wallet credential generation for a user-initiated 'Create Wallet' action that generates: (1) a public wallet address, (2) a private key, and (3) a recovery seed phrase (mnemonic). Ensure generation uses secure randomness available on the Internet Computer and is not derived from predictable inputs (e.g., time-only).

projectName: Initialize EPIQ Wallet: manual wallet creation (up to 9) with address + private key + recovery phrase
